title: Cadbury's will sell giant tubs of Creme Eggs at Easter
text:
We can’t wait for the giant tins of chocolate which only seem to surface in supermarkets at Christmas time. Now, imagine one filled up with Creme Eggs.

Yes, it sounds like a dream but come Easter 2020, after we’ve demolished the six-pack of Creme Eggs, we’ll be able to go straight for the tin.

Weighing a staggering 401g, Cadbury’s has announced the launch of its giant tin of Creme Eggs and we’re already salivating.

Father Christmas, who?

READ MORE: Start Christmas early with Lindor white truffles

Because Cadbury’s loves us, it’s also launching a Mini Egg tin.

We’re still awaiting key information from Cadbury’s pertaining to a release date for our new favourite tin. The only other thing we’re unclear on is whether or not the Creme Eggs will be miniature or full size.

Whilst we contemplate how devastated we would be if they turn out to be miniature, here are a few other new releases Cadbury’s has announced for Easter 2020.

READ MORE: Cadbury’s set to launch a mint Flake

For the first time ever, a dark chocolate Bourneville Easter bunny will be hitting the shops. If dark chocolate isn’t your thing, there will also be a Dairy Milk bunny bar on offer.

We’ll also see a Choco-latte egg for the first time. This blend of chocolate, coffee cream and digestive pieces was created after Callum Clogher, who entered the Cadbury Go Madbury competition in 2019, came up with the idea.

We have one thing to say to you Callum: Thank you.

If you’ve got a better idea for a chocolate bar, Cadbury’s are re-opening the competition for 2020.

READ MORE: Maltesers white chocolate truffles are a thing

The Creme Egg and Mini Egg tins will cost £5.99 and be available from April next year.

If you can’t wait for your sugar hit, Costa has just announced its Christmas menu and a Terry’s Chocolate Orange muffin will be available from 1 November.

It’s no Creme Egg tin, but we’ll get by until Easter.
